item.title: Blog: 2020-10-23: IAC Team Status Update
item.description:
Community Contributions

We’d like to thank the following people in the Puppet Community for their contributions over this past week:

  • puppetlabs-docker#671: “Fix array of additional flags”, thanks to CAPSLOCK2000
  • puppetlabs-docker#669: “Support multiple mirrors #659”, thanks to TheLocehiliosan
  • puppetlabs-docker#667: “Test against OS family rather than name”, thanks to bodgit
  • puppetlabs-java_ks#333: “add storetype parameter comparison to ‘destroy’ method”, thanks to mwpower
  • puppetlabs-java_ks#332: “Correct jceks symbol comparison”, thanks to mwpower
  • puppetlabs-stdlib#1132: “Stdlib::HttpStatus: add type for HTTP status codes as per rfc2616”, thanks to b4ldr
  • pdk-templates#355: “(#352) Add .puppet-lint.rc and .sync.yml to .pdkignore”, thanks to silug
  • puppet-module-gems#143: “Add initial setup of gitpod config files”, thanks to logicminds
  • puppet-resource_api#279: “Improve type validation error messages to show expected types”, thanks to timidri
  • puppet-resource_api#278: “Support puppet device --resource ... --to_yaml invocation; drop puppet4 and jruby 1.7 testing”, thanks to timidri
  • puppet-strings#255: “Fix ERB failure - parameters without descriptions”, thanks to trevor-vaughan
  • puppet-lint#931: “Disallow empty lines between docs and class/define”, thanks to ekohl and the following people who helped get it over the line (ehelms)

Customer Issues

Team is actively working on resolving following new issues on puppetlabs-package module.

  • MODULES-10842
  • MODULES-10844

Fix for puppetlabs-tagmail module for the following issue MODULES-10814 is in review stage.

Life of an intern at Puppet

Disha continues her journey at Puppet and here you can find the last updates of ** Life of an intern at Puppet ** .

Puppet 7 Nightly Testing

A big thank you to the Nights Watch team, specifically, Florin and Bogdan for the help to test and fix MODULES-10833 in puppetlabs-facter_task module.

CI Improvements

Hacktoberfest is an annual event hosted by DigitalOcean and DEV.to in order to promote Open Source collaboration. More details can be found here. It was held on 20-Oct-2020 and we did a demo on Trusted Contributor CI project where public (test-)pull request run unit and acceptance tests on entirely public infrastructure and report the results in public. Thanks to David, Dany and Michael for the demo.

As part of that work, we submitted some work and bug report to upstream repos:

  • Fix fallback filename when using a subdirectory: GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-builders-community#456

Expect more detailed blog posts and announcements as we continue to progress towards a production-ready stable service.

Wrap-up

That’s it for this weeks update, have a great weekend everyone!
